intro: Laplacea villosa, commonly known as the hairy laplacea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It thrives in moist, temperate climates and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
